author: Staff Reporter
text:
Cadres of CPI (M) staging a protest in front of the Office of the Adidravidar Welfare demanding allotment of houses at Kalitheerthankuppam to eligible people and construction of burial ground in Puducherry on Tuesday.– PHOTO: M. Samraj

Activists of the Communist Party of India (M) on Tuesday staged a demonstration in front of the Department of Adi-dravidar Welfare in Thattanchavady. They protested against the delay in implementation of various welfare schemes.

The protestors were led by V. Perumal, state Executive Committee member of the CPI (M). They demanded the Government to ensure transparency in the allotment of group houses to beneficiaries at Kalitheerthankuppam.

The protestors also demanded free house site pattas to those living on Government poromboke land in Puducherry and to expedite welfare schemes for Dalits among others.
title: CPI (M) slams delay in schemes
